custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Papers consist of correspondence originally from the files of the Business Manager.

eventgrp.event: Grant in Aid from the Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research (RIMR).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Early correspondence deals with grants made by RIMR upon the recommendation of Franklin Mall of the Johns Hopkins Anatomical Laboratory for research on "vital staining" and for work done in European laboratories.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In 1930 negotiations began for arrangements to work at RIMR as a visitor bringing with him some members from his own department at the Institute of Experimental Biology at the University of California.

did.unittitle: Correspondence, Photographs, News items, Budget records

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Worked at RIMR as a volunteer investigator from the autumn of 1932 to the summer of 1933. Correspondence deals with the laboratory arrangements.
1933 November 8 letter Simon Flexner to Raymond B. Fosdick giving opinion of H.M. Evans.
1935 January 24 letters H.M. Evans to Simon Flexner and Board of Scientific Directors in thanks for seven week training at the Princeton laboratories of Karl Korpi.
